questions.question: Vectors have __________ and __________.
What do single, double, and triple arrowhead vectors represent?
questions.answer: Single: heading/TAS. Double: track/GS. Triple: wind direction/wind speed.

questions.question: Does wind direction give direction the wind comes from, or direction the wind goes to?
Decode this wind information: 260/19.
When is wind direction given in °magnetic?
questions.answer: Takeoff and landing reports provided by ATC or flight service. ATIS. Automated weather reports at uncontrolled aerodromes.

questions.question: When is wind direction given in °T?
questions.answer: For flight planning, eg. Metservice, or given in flight by Flight Information Service.

questions.question: What vectors can be combined to get a Track/Groundspeed vector?
questions.answer: Heading/TAS and wind direction/wind speed (Wind Velocity vector, or W/V vector).

questions.question: What is an aircraft's "track"?
questions.answer: Path of the aircraft over the Earth's surface.

questions.question: What is the Track Made Good (TMG)?
questions.answer: The actual track being flown by the aircraft.

questions.question: The Drift Angle is the angle between the __________ and the __________.
The drift angle depends on __________ and __________.
A high wind velocity results in a (large/small) drift angle.
A low wind velocity results in a (large/small) drift angle.
A low TAS results in a (large/small) drift angle.
A high TAS results in a (large/small) drift angle.
Drift is measured from the __________ to the __________.
Starboard drift pushes the aircraft to the (right/left), ie. wind is from the (right/left).
Port drift pushes the aircraft to the (right/left), ie. wind is from the (right/left).
What do you do to apply drift correction? What happens if it is correctly applied?
questions.answer: Point the nose of the aircraft into the direction the wind comes from. Track (TRK) and Track Made Good (TMG) are the same.

questions.question: Track Error (TE) is the difference between __________ and __________.
Drift Error is measured from  _____ to _____. Track Error is measured from  _____ to _____.
questions.answer: HDG to TRK. TRK to TMG.

questions.question: Tailwind is identified by a (+/-). Headwind is identified by a (+/-).
+23 kt is a 23 knot (headwind/tailwind) component.
-14 kt is a 14 knot (headwind/tailwind) component.
